bug.short_desc: Same origin policy breaks orientationChange event and qx.bom.ViewPort functions

long_desc.thetext:
In case of using qooxdoo app in an iframe and if top frame is not in same domain, the same origin policy (SOP) throws an error wich can't be catched (tested in chrome) if you are using getOrientation() function of qx.bom.ViewPort or register "orientationChange" event.
So three ways are possible to solve that problem:
1. postMessage fuction called from top frame could privide us with orientation type. But this is not a solution for a framework.
2. We are using "resize" event instead of native "orientationChange" if qooxdoo runs in a iframe and top frame is not in same domain. Therefor we have to determine if SOP takes effect or not. The only way I could find is to make a ajax request to the domain of top frame. If SOP effects the request will be returned as rejected.
3. We are just using "resize" event if qooxdoo runs in an iframe anyway.
I guess the third. solution can handle it.

Just using "resize" on window object was not the solution, because IOS Safari just allows resize events on top frame, which can be blocked by SOP.
But qooxdoo has a solution to file "resize" events on any dom element (qx.event.handler.ElementResize). So I am forwarding "orientationChange" through "element resize" event of document.documentElement. To take effect the environment must be "in iframe" and "IOS". Android is not testet jet.
As long as the bug is not fixed in master, we should keep the report open.
